geoidep 0.1.0

Download Geographic Data on Various Topics Provided and Managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure of Peru

Source: vignettes/geoidep.Rmd
geoidep.Rmd

Introducction

This package provides R users with a new way to access Peru’s official cartographic data on various topics that are managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure of Peru.

Working with R 

library(ggplot2)
library(geoidep)
#> 
#> ── Welcome to geoidep ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> ℹ geoidep is a wrapper that allows you to download cartographic data for Peru from R.
#> Currently, `geoidep` supports the following providers:
#> ✔ Geobosque
#> ✔ INEI
#> ✔ Midagri
#> ✔ Sernanp
#> ℹ For more information, please use the `get_data_sources()` function.

Official Administrative Boundaries by INEI 

departaments <- get_departaments(show_progress = FALSE)
names(departaments)
#> [1] "id"           "OBJECTID"     "CCDD"         "NOMBDEP"      "SHAPE_Length"
#> [6] "SHAPE_Area"   "geom"
# Display the first 10 rows of the data frame `departaments`
head(departaments)
#> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 6 fields
#> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
#> Dimension:     XY
#> Bounding box:  xmin: -79.45857 ymin: -17.28501 xmax: -70.80408 ymax: -2.986125
#> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
#>   id OBJECTID CCDD   NOMBDEP SHAPE_Length SHAPE_Area

Simple Visualization 

ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = departaments) +
  theme_minimal()
